dc:title: Open Letter to John Brophy, CIO Director
dc:creator: Dorothy Day
dc:description: Urges John Brophey, the C.I.O. trade unions director, to use the technique of sit-down strikes, a nonviolent form of coercion, a means used by Gandhi and an example of pure means advocated by Maritain. "The use of force is unchristian."
